intro: Lhotskya ericoides, commonly known as the Himalayan heath, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows at high altitudes, where it thrives in well-drained, acidic soils. Its compact growth habit and resilience to cold temperatures make it a hardy species adapted to harsh mountain environments. Lhotskya ericoides plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for alpine flora and fauna.
